references.paper_title: Rank Analysis of Incomplete Block Designs: I. The Method of Paired Comparisons
references.reason: This paper introduces the Bradley-Terry model, a fundamental statistical model for paired comparisons, which is directly relevant to the proposed algorithm's knockout stage.

references.paper_title: Are More LLM Calls All You Need? Towards the Scaling Properties of Compound AI Systems
references.reason: This paper directly addresses the question of scaling up test-time compute for LLMs, which is the central focus of the current paper.

references.paper_title: On the Design and Analysis of LLM-Based Algorithms
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational theoretical analysis of LLM-based algorithms, which the current work builds upon.

references.paper_title: Large Language Models are Zero-Shot Reasoners
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the capability of LLMs as zero-shot reasoners, which is crucial for the generation stage of the proposed algorithm.

references.paper_title: Chain of Thought Prompting Elicits Reasoning in Large Language Models
references.reason: This paper introduces chain-of-thought prompting, a technique used in the current paper to elicit reasoning processes from LLMs for improved pairwise comparisons.
